thread.title: Pucker up, ready for your close up: Hilarious photos show llamas in Argentina posing for selfies with tourists
thread.title_full: Pucker up, ready for your close up: Hilarious photos show llamas in Argentina posing for selfies with tourists | Daily Mail Online

author: John Hutchinson for MailOnline
title: Pucker up, ready for your close up: Hilarious photos show llamas in Argentina posing for selfies with tourists
text:
7 shares 2
View
comments
These hilarious pictures show the moment a tourist managed to get a selfie with some very photogenic llamas.
The cheeky animals look as if they were keen to get involved in the photo shoot, posing for lots of pictures of themselves as well as with the photographer.
Photographer Mauro, from Buenos Aires came across the llamas in Mirador El Infiernillo, Argentina, and was instantly drawn to them.
Scroll down for video
Mauro was instantly drawn to the llamas and decided to snap the happy occasion
This llama pulls an unusual face for the camera after it was snapped by a tourist in Argentina
Far from being scared by the camera, the llamas looked to play up for the photographer
He said: 'We wanted to stop and say hello, so I crouched down wanting to get a picture with the brown llama behind me.
'I didn't want to leave without getting a selfie to put on my Instagram, but when I was crouched down, this huge white llama jumps in and photobombs it! It was hilarious.'
 Next Forget a holiday home... how about a holiday village? You... The caravan park café in a potting shed which has made the... 35 miles, 2 million truck loads of earth and £6.5 billion... Dusk till dawn: From Sydney to Arizona, photographer... Mauro has had lots of likes on social media of his selfies, and people have told him how hilarious the images are.
But with the side-splitting faces that these llamas are pulling, it's no wonder he has been so popular.
It's not every day you find some very willing llamas to jump in on your pictures.
These hilarious pictures show the moment a tourist managed to get a selfie with some very photogenic llamas
But Mauro will have been wise to keep a close eye on the furry creatures.
Last month MailOnline reported on the moment a llama expressed its annoyance and spat in a woman’s face in a zoo.
In the clip shown below, the woman moves in close to the animal and makes a series of squeaking noises.
It is unclear as to what reaction she hopes to evoke from the llama, as she appears to lean in to give it a kiss.
The animal, who tilts its head back in preparation, retaliates by spitting and hitting her square in the face.
She reacts by pulling away in disgust and coughing as the llama causally returns to its original position.
Little information has been provided alongside the clip and the location of the zoo is unknown.
Llamas, a relative of camels, have previously received attention for their spitting habits.
Photographer Mauro, from Buenos Aires came across the llamas in Mirador El Infiernillo, Argentina
